title: Higher costs set to hammer Bellway margins
text:
Bellway warned that a slowdown in house price growth and rising building costs would put pressure on its margins, even as it raised potential payouts to shareholders.

The FTSE 250 builder defied wider gloom in the housing market as it sold 585 more homes than it did the previous year, delivering record completions of 10,892 properties in the 12 months to July.

This pushed annual revenues up nearly 9pc to just over £3bn, while pre-tax profits rose 3pc to £662.6m.

Bellway said the growth in profits had allowed it to raise the dividend by more than 5pc to 150.4p a share.

Sales demand also increased, with a 5pc rise in the reservation rate to a record high of 210 homes a week.

Despite some market...
description: Bellway warned that a slowdown in house price growth and rising building costs would put pressure on its margins, even as it raised potential payouts to shareholders.
